textfield:
this is an example about multichannel signal routing

envM is creating a 4channel signal 
which is split and goes to different
signal inputs of fmrm1

click on the â‰ˆ button on top in the ll.blues output section of envM. 
that is where the single channels are routed to. additional there are min-max values that scale the signals to reasonable values for the chosen parameter.

note, that the according parameters in fmrm1 are all set to 0, if you change that they act as offsets.

if you select "mess" in envM's menu appearing as "sig"
envM will send out messages going to its attached control@.

click on presets of this notepad@1 for more...

in envM there are some presets stored.
the button p-t makes these presets triggering the envelope.

you may note that len (envelope-length) and the loop button are not affected by these presets - they stay where you put it.
thats because these parameters are NOT active.
you can see and change this with the clientwindow's leftmost checkboxes.

in fmrm1 there are presets as well.
they change the "sp"-parameters aka spread.
spread deviates the multichannel

spread deviates the according parameter.
since fmrm1 is currently playing 2 channels,
spread unfolds these 2 channels.

you can chance the internal channels of fmrm by selecting more input-channels (i) in ll.blues.
